CatDescriptText: Chuck Branson, cab driver, Shadyside and Jack A. Morris, retired, Squirrel Hill, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 13, 1960, pg. 29 with question: "Do you think that married students of high school age should be permitted to attend school with other students who are single?"  Chuck Branson's answer reads: "Yes, because it gives a better insight into the feelings of each."  Jack A. Morris' answer reads: "Absolutely.  It places mature minds with those of lesser experience."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Chuck Branson wearing People's Cab uniform with cap and dark tie, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Downtown; Portrait of Jack A. Morris wearing dark fedora, eyeglasses, dark double breasted overcoat, and light colored scarf, standing on sidewalk, Downtown
